result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J. Jung was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
No contact with co-defendant, Angelia Scoville.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
 Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor compliance with conditions. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Participate in any other counseling or assessments recommended by the agent.
Eligible for substance abuse and Challenge programs after 2 years.
Credit to be determined.

1:29 p.m. Defendant Gregory J. Jung in court with attorney John Bliss and Atty Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case 16CF7 is heard for a Plea & Sentencing Hearing and 15CF375 Sentencing Hearing.
16CF7:  Plea & Sentencing Hearing 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney Bliss for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: No Contest
Count 2: No Contest
Count 3: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1, 2, & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 Counts 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, & 9 are dismissed and read In.


ADA Knaapen makes sentencing statements.
Atty Sheets 15CF375 concurs with the joint recommendation.
Atty Bliss 16CF7 concurs with the joint recommendation and request bond and computers be returned.
ADA Knaapen states objections on the record.
Credit to be stipulated by the Parties.

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION**
15CF375 Ct 1:  I/S Sentence 4 yrs Incarceration & 6 yrs Extended Supervision, concurrent with Ct 3 - Stayed (credit TBD - Atty Sheets)
24 months Probation
Conditions:
 AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
 Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor compliance with conditions. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.  
Participate in any other counseling or assessments recommended by the agent.
No contact with co-defendant, Angelia Scoville.
Pay costs + surcharges including DNA surcharges.
Eligible for substance abuse and Challenge programs after 2 years.

15CF375 Ct 3:  I/S Sentence 3 yrs Incarceration & 3 yrs Extended Supervision, concurrent with Ct 1
24 months Probation, concurrent
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.
Pay costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge.

16CF7 Ct 1:W/H Sentence - (credit TBD - Atty Bliss)
24 months Probation, concurrent w/15CF375
Conditions:
Pay restitution of $160.00. (bond to be applied first)
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CF375
Pay costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge.

16CF7 Count 2: W/H Sentence
24 months Probation, concurrent w/15CF375
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CF375.
Pay costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge.

16CF7 Count 3: W/H Sentence
24 months Probation, concurrent w/15CF375
Conditions:

#2 Squad video (DVD) not scanned
#1 Incident Report Narrative

Defendant Gregory J. Jung in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Gregory J. Jung in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:04 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a motion hearing today.

Court addresses the Court, read the motion to suppress earlier. 
Atty Sheets has an additional copy for the motion to suppress.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court, State did not complete a writ for the last hearing.
Defendant is in Portage County now, unpaid civil matter was in Wood County but then has been in Portage County on this matter ever since.

Parties are prepared to proceed.

11:07 AM Dustin Kitzman is called and sworn in, Deputy Sheriff.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen. 
Witness identifies Defendant.
11:24 AM Cross-examination by Atty Sheets.
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of Defense, is referred to.
11:44 AM Squad Video is played at this time (no audio). 11:55 AM Use of video is concluded.
11:57 AM Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.
12:02 PM Re-cross by Atty Sheets.
12:07 PM Examination by the Court, for clarifications.
12:10 PM Re-direct by Atty Knaapen.
12:10 PM Re-cross by Atty Sheets.
12:12 PM Examination by the Court.

12:13 PM Court is in recess until 1:15 PM.

Exhibit #2 is marked on behalf of Defense, prior to Court starting in the afternoon.

1:31 PM Court is back on the record on this matter.
Same appearances.

Completed was witness Deputy Kitzman.

State has no further witnesses.

Atty Sheets has no witnesses, but offers both exhibits.

BY THE COURT:
Exhibits #1-#2 are offered and received.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, requests motion be denied.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court.

Atty Knaapen replies.

Atty Sheets gives final remarks before the Court gives its decision.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.

There is a motion to modify bond that was filed as well.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court regarding bond, requests a lower cash bond for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding bond, the bond set is appropriate.

Atty Sheets replies.

Court addresses the parties.

Atty Sheets addresses the Court.
Defendant addresses the Court.

BY THE COURT:
At this point and time, Court denies request for a change in the bond. The bond set is appropriate. Court would be willing to entertain home detention but has to be in Portage County.  At this point, Court will deny change of bond. 

Parties are to set a date for a trial.
